00010 #include <stdio.h>
00011 #include <stdlib.h>

00015 #define LINE_LENGTH 255
00016 
00017 typedef struct
00018 {
00019     int id, x, y;
00020 } tsp_2d_node;
00021 
00022 int numnodes, *sol, max;
00023 int adj_list, disp_cities, disp_edges, disp_labels, create_eps;
00024 tsp_2d_node *node;
00025 char *delims = " :\t\n";

00027 
00035 int setDimension(char *line)
00036 {
00037     char *temp = strtok(line, delims);
00038     if (!strcmp(temp, "DIMENSION"))
00039     {
00040         temp = strtok(NULL, delims);
00041         numnodes = (int)strtol(temp, NULL, 10);
00042         node = (tsp_2d_node *)malloc(sizeof(tsp_2d_node)*numnodes);
00043         if (node == NULL)
00044         {
00045             printf("ERROR: Couldn't allocate memory for node array\n");
00046             exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
00047         }
00048 
00049         sol = (int *)malloc(sizeof(int)*numnodes);
00050         if (sol == NULL)
00051         {
00052             printf("ERROR: Couldn't allocate memory for sol array\n");
00053             free(node);
00054             exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
00055         }
00056 
00057         return 1;
00058     }
00059     return 0;
00060 }
00061 
00062 
00069 int isNodeCoordHeader(char *line)
00070 {
00071     char *temp = strtok(line, delims);
00072     if (!strcmp(temp, "NODE_COORD_SECTION"))
00073         return 1;
00074     else
00075         return 0;
00076 }

00092 int extractNodeData(char *line, int *id, int *xcoord, int *ycoord)
00093 {
00094     char *temp = strtok(line, delims);
00095     if (!strcmp(temp, "EOF"))
00096         return 1;
00097     else
00098     {
00099         *id = (int)strtol(temp, NULL, 10);
00100 
00101         temp = strtok(NULL, delims);
00102         *xcoord = (int)strtol(temp, NULL, 10);
00103 
00104         temp = strtok(NULL, delims);
00105         *ycoord = (int)strtol(temp, NULL, 10);
00106 
00107         if (*xcoord > max) max = *xcoord;
00108         if (*ycoord > max) max = *ycoord;
00109     }
00110     return 0;
00111 }

00120 void read_tsp_file(char *tspfilename)
00121 {
00122     char line[LINE_LENGTH], *temp;
00123     int finished = 0, got_dimension = 0, reading_node_data = 0, i;
00124     FILE *tspfp;
00125 
00126     tspfp = fopen(tspfilename, "r");
00127     if (tspfp == NULL)
00128     {
00129         printf("ERROR: Couldn't open TSP file '%s'\n", tspfilename);
00130         exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
00131     }
00132 
00133     while (!finished)
00134     {
00135         if (fgets(line, LINE_LENGTH, tspfp) != NULL)
00136         {
00137             char *newline = strchr(line, '\n'); /* search for newline character */
00138             if (newline != NULL)
00139             {
00140                 *newline = '\0'; /* overwrite trailing newline */
00141             }
00142 
00143             strupr(line);
00144             if (!got_dimension)
00145                 got_dimension = setDimension(line);
00146             else if (!reading_node_data)
00147             {
00148                 if (isNodeCoordHeader(line))
00149                 {
00150                     reading_node_data = 1;
00151                     i = 0;
00152                 }
00153             }
00154             else
00155             {
00156                 finished = extractNodeData(line, &(node[i].id), &(node[i].x), &(node[i].y));
00157                 i++;
00158             }
00159         }
00160         else
00161             finished = 1;
00162     }
00163     fclose(tspfp);
00164 }

00173 void read_sol_file(char *solfilename)
00174 {
00175     FILE *solfp;
00176     int finished = 0, i = 0;
00177     char line[LINE_LENGTH], *temp;
00178 
00179     solfp = fopen(solfilename, "r");
00180     if (solfp == NULL)
00181     {
00182         printf("ERROR: Couldn't open TSP solution file '%s'\n", solfilename);
00183         exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
00184     }
00185 
00186     /* The first line contains only one number --- the dimension. We already have this
00187        information and so we don't need it. */
00188     if (fgets(line, LINE_LENGTH, solfp) == NULL)
00189         finished = 1;
00190 
00191     while (!finished)
00192     {
00193         if (fgets(line, LINE_LENGTH, solfp) != NULL)
00194         {
00195             char *newline = strchr(line, '\n'); /* search for newline character */
00196             if (newline != NULL)
00197             {
00198                 *newline = '\0'; /* overwrite trailing newline */
00199             }
00200 
00201             temp = strtok(line, delims);
00202 
00203             if (adj_list)
00204             {
00205                 sol[i] = (int)strtol(temp, NULL, 10);
00206                 i++;
00207             }
00208             else
00209             {
00210                 while (temp != NULL)
00211                 {
00212                     sol[i] = (int)strtol(temp, NULL, 10);
00213                     i++;
00214                     temp = strtok(NULL, delims);
00215                 }
00216             }
00217         }
00218         else
00219             finished = 1;
00220     }
00221     fclose(solfp);
00222 }

00233 void create_mp_file(char *solfilename)
00234 {
00235     char *str;
00236     FILE *mpfp;
00237     int i, j;
00238 
00239     if (create_eps)
00240     {
00241         str = (char *)malloc(strlen(solfilename) + 4);
00242         sprintf(str, "%s.mp", solfilename);
00243         mpfp = fopen(str, "w");
00244         if (mpfp == NULL)
00245         {
00246             printf("ERROR: Couldn't create MetaPost file '%s'\n", str);
00247             exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
00248         }
00249 
00250         /* Let's begin. */
00251         fprintf(mpfp, "beginfig(1);\n\nu = 1cm;\n\n");
00252 
00253         /*********************************************************************************
00254          *  NOTE: The nodes (in the .mp file) are labelled 0..n because the labels       *
00255          *        obtained from the TSP file are not used by Concorde. For some reason,  *
00256          *        the Concorde program does not use the actual node labels when creating *
00257          *        the solution file. So if the first city is given the label 1 (in the   *
00258          *        TSP file) then it is referred to as city 0 in the solution file.       *
00259          *                                                                               *
00260          *        If this ever changes, some of the 'i's in the fprintf statements must  *
00261          *        be replaced with node[i].id.                                           *
00262          *********************************************************************************/
00263 
00264         if (disp_labels)
00265             fprintf(mpfp, "drawoptions(withcolor .8white);\n");
00266 
00267         /* Plot the nodes/cities. MetaPost doesn't like numbers larger than 4096, so
00268            we will make sure that the size of the drawing is at most 20cm x 20cm. */
00269         if (disp_cities)
00270         {
00271             fprintf(mpfp, "\n");
00272             fprintf(mpfp, "pickup pencircle scaled 3pt;\n");
00273             for (i = 0; i < numnodes; i++)
00274             {
00275                 fprintf(mpfp, "drawdot (%.4f*u, %.4f*u);\n", 20.0*node[i].x/max, 20.0*node[i].y/max);
00276             }
00277             fprintf(mpfp, "\n");
00278         }
00279     }
00280 
00281 
00282     /* Compute the cost and/or draw the solution path. */
00283     if (disp_edges)
00284         fprintf(mpfp, "pickup pencircle scaled 1pt;\n");
00285     double cost = 0.0;
00286     i = 0;
00287     while (i < numnodes)
00288     {
00289         if (i < numnodes)
00290         {
00291             if (disp_edges)
00292                 fprintf(mpfp, "draw (%.4f*u, %.4f*u)", 20.0*node[sol[i]].x/max, 20.0*node[sol[i]].y/max);
00293             i++;
00294         }
00295         for (j = 0; j < 5 && i < numnodes; j++)
00296         {
00297             if (disp_edges)
00298                 fprintf(mpfp, "--(%.4f*u, %.4f*u)", 20.0*node[sol[i]].x/max, 20.0*node[sol[i]].y/max);
00299             cost += sqrt((node[sol[i]].x - node[sol[i-1]].x)*(node[sol[i]].x - node[sol[i-1]].x) + (node[sol[i]].y - node[sol[i-1]].y)*(node[sol[i]].y - node[sol[i-1]].y));
00300             i++;
00301         }
00302         if (disp_edges)
00303             fprintf(mpfp, ";\n");
00304 
00305         /* We need to plot the last city plotted (in the for loop) again to ensure that
00306            there is a cycle. */
00307         if (i < numnodes) i--;
00308     }
00309     /* Finish the cycle. */
00310     if (disp_edges)
00311         fprintf(mpfp, "draw (%.4f*u, %.4f*u)--(%.4f*u, %.4f*u);\n", 20.0*node[sol[numnodes-1]].x/max, 20.0*node[sol[numnodes-1]].y/max, 20.0*node[sol[0]].x/max, 20.0*node[sol[0]].y/max);
00312     cost += sqrt((node[sol[numnodes-1]].x - node[sol[0]].x)*(node[sol[numnodes-1]].x - node[sol[0]].x) + (node[sol[numnodes-1]].y - node[sol[0]].y)*(node[sol[numnodes-1]].y - node[sol[0]].y));
00313 
00314 
00315     /* Label each node/city. */
00316     if (disp_labels)
00317     {
00318         fprintf(mpfp, "\n");
00319         fprintf(mpfp, "drawoptions(withcolor black);\n");
00320         fprintf(mpfp, "\n");
00321         fprintf(mpfp, "defaultscale := 0.2;\n");
00322         for (i = 0; i < numnodes; i++)
00323         {
00324             fprintf(mpfp, "label.bot(\"%d\", (%.4f*u, %.4f*u));\n", sol[i], 20.0*node[sol[i]].x/max, 20.0*node[sol[i]].y/max);
00325         }
00326         fprintf(mpfp, "\n");
00327     }
00328 
00329 
00330     printf("\nCost: %.4f\n\n", cost);
00331 
00332     if (create_eps)
00333     {
00334         /* We're done. */
00335         fprintf(mpfp, "endfig;\n\n");
00336         fprintf(mpfp, "%% Cost: %.4f\n", cost);
00337         fclose(mpfp);
00338 
00339         char *command;
00340         asprintf(&command, "mpost %s", str);
00341         system(command);
00342         free(str);
00343     }
00344 }

00354 void input_str(char *message, char *input, int input_size)
00355 {
00356     fputs(message, stdout);
00357     fflush(stdout);
00358     if (fgets(input, input_size, stdin) != NULL)
00359     {
00360         char *newline = strchr(input, '\n'); /* search for newline character */
00361         if (newline != NULL)
00362         {
00363             *newline = '\0'; /* overwrite trailing newline */
00364         }
00365     }
00366 }

00375 void display_help(char *prog)
00376 {
00377     printf("Usage: %s [-OPTION(S)] <TSPlib file> <Solution file>\n", prog);
00378     printf("\n");
00379     printf("  -a  Tells the program the TSP solution is represented as an adjacency/edge list.\n");
00380     printf("      Otherwise, it is assumed the solution is represented as a sequence of nodes.\n");
00381     printf("  -c  Displays the cities.\n");
00382     printf("  -e  Displays the edges.\n");
00383     printf("  -l  Displays the labels.\n");
00384     printf("  -h  Displays this help and exits.\n");
00385     printf("\n");
00386     printf("If you choose not to display anything, then no METAPOST and PostScript files will\n");
00387     printf("be created. Only the cost of the tour is displayed.\n");
00388 }

00390 
00391 int main(int argc, char **argv)
00392 {
00393     char *t, *s;
00394 
00395     adj_list = 0;
00396     disp_cities = 0;
00397     disp_edges = 0;
00398     disp_labels = 0;
00399     create_eps = 0;
00400 
00401     /* Check if the user gave any of the option arguments. */
00402     int c;
00403     while ((c = getopt (argc, argv, ":acelh")) != -1)
00404     {
00405         switch (c)
00406         {
00407             case 'a':
00408                 adj_list = 1;
00409                 break;
00410             case 'c':
00411                 disp_cities = 1;
00412                 break;
00413             case 'e':
00414                 disp_edges = 1;
00415                 break;
00416             case 'l':
00417                 disp_labels = 1;
00418                 break;
00419             case 'h':
00420                 display_help(argv[0]);
00421                 return 1;
00422             case '?':
00423                 fprintf(stderr, "Ignoring unrecognized option: -%c\n", optopt);
00424         }
00425     }
00426     create_eps = (disp_cities || disp_edges || disp_labels);
00427 
00428     /* Get the tsp and solution file names. */
00429     if ((argc - optind) < 2)
00430     {
00431         display_help(argv[0]);
00432         return 1;
00433     }
00434     else
00435     {
00436         t = argv[optind];
00437         s = argv[optind+1];
00438     }
00439 
00440     node = NULL;
00441     sol  = NULL;
00442     max = 0;
00443 
00444     read_tsp_file(t);
00445     read_sol_file(s);
00446     if (numnodes == 0)
00447         printf("There are no nodes/cities in the tsp file.\n");
00448     else
00449         create_mp_file(s);
00450 
00451     if (node != NULL) free(node);
00452     if (sol  != NULL) free(sol);
00453 
00454     return EXIT_SUCCESS;
00455 }
